ParentCompanyName: Linn Cooperative Oil Co. - Marion, Iowa

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility : Linn Cooperative Oil Co. - Springville Plant
Contact : Tracy Peyton   Phone : 319-854-6192

1.   Facility Policy

     The owners, management and employees of Linn Coop Oil Co.- Springville Plant are committed to the
prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility
is prepared to work with the Springville fire dept., Linn County LEPC, and /or other authorities to mitigate and
minimize the impacts of the release to people and the environment.

2.  Facility Information

     The primary activity at the plant is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product, anhydrous
ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. Anhydrous
ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3.  Accidental Release Prevention Program

    The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration
(OSHA),29 CFR 1910.111,"Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and our state regulations covering
anhydrous ammonia. The OSHA standard is referenced in the RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3(b).

4.  Five-Year Accident History

     There have been no accidental releases of NH3 that have caused death, injuries, evacuations, property damage,
or environmental damage at the plant or off-site. 

5.  Emergency Action Plan

    The facility has:
     a.  A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.36;
     b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and Community right-to-know information
         as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA)
     c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate
         the area and call 911(Fire Dept.) and Linn County LEPC.

6. Planned  Changes to Improve Safety

    Safety improvement is an ongoing process at the facility. Periodic evaluations

are performed to assess the 
    conditions of the plant.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use 
    of anhydrous ammonia at this time.
